snippet: A decade after President Obama made his national political debut with an appeal for Americans to put aside their divisions, the midterm elections delivered a resounding rejection of his call for consensus.
abstract: News analysis; midterm elections deliver resounding rejection of Pres Obama's call for consensus among Americans, which he made a decade ago in his national political debut; elections illustrate geographical limitations of party Obama powerfully remade with young and diverse coalition.
lead_paragraph: A decade after President Obama made his national political debut with an appeal for Americans to put aside their divisions, the midterm elections delivered a resounding rejection of his call for consensus.

headline.main: Voters’ Second Thoughts on Hope and Change
headline.print_headline: Voters’ Second Thoughts on Hope and Change
